title: JangoUnchained
author: JangoUnchained
content: I have a 3080 graphic card that wont displayed on the monitor, I tried few Hdmi cables like 2.1 and the old HDMI but no display still, the funny thing is I can get display straight from fhs the motherboard only or if I insert a older GPU like 1060 I get a display, what should I look into next.

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: Quote from: JangoUnchained on June 02, 2022, 05:50:28 AMI have a 3080 graphic card that wont displayed on the monitor, I tried few Hdmi cables like 2.1 and the old HDMI but no display still, the funny thing is I can get display straight from fhs the motherboard only or if I insert a older GPU like 1060 I get a display, what should I look into next.What motherboard? Windows recognize this GPU?

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: JangoUnchained on June 02, 2022, 05:50:28 AMI have a 3080 graphic card that wont displayed on the monitor, I tried few Hdmi cables like 2.1 and the old HDMI but no display still, the funny thing is I can get display straight from fhs the motherboard only or if I insert a older GPU like 1060 I get a display, what should I look into next.In the BIOS of the motherboard there is an option Graphic Adapter Priority, where you can select the GPU priority - built-in or discrete GPU. You may have an old motherboard that does not recognize the new RTX 3000 series graphics cards.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: Looks like your current motherboard is too old, what type of motherboard you using? I have seen whereby my RTX 3070 ti won't display on a second-generation gigabyte motherboard and I updated its bios then it works, maybe you can try the same thing out first.
